bitfield.name: BUFFER_INTERLEAVING
bitfield.brief: Supports interleaving depth and color buffers

bitfield.name: YUY2_RENDER_TARGET
bitfield.brief: YUY2 support in PE and YUY2 to RGB conversion in resolve

bitfield.name: 32_BIT_INDICES
bitfield.brief: 32 bit indices can be used with indexed drawing

bitfield.name: FLIP_Y
bitfield.brief: Y flipping capability is added to resolve

bitfield.name: DUAL_RETURN_BUS
bitfield.brief: Dual Return Bus from HI to clients

bitfield.name: SPECIAL_MSAA_LOD
bitfield.brief: Special LOD calculation when MSAA is on

bitfield.name: FAST_CLEAR_FLUSH
bitfield.brief: Proper flush is done in fast clear cache

bitfield.name: 2BITPERTILE
bitfield.brief: Two status bits per tile (instead of four)

bitfield.name: SEPARATE_TILE_STATUS_WHEN_INTERLEAVED
bitfield.brief: Use 2 separate tile status buffers in interleaved mode

bitfield.name: VG_20
bitfield.brief: Major updates to VG pipe (TS buffer tiling, state masking)

bitfield.name: TS_EXTENDED_COMMANDS
bitfield.brief: New commands added to the VG tessellator

bitfield.name: HAS_SIGN_FLOOR_CEIL
bitfield.brief: Has SIGN, FLOOR and CEIL shader instructions

bitfield.name: VG_21
bitfield.brief: Minor updates to VG pipe (Event generation from VG, TS, PE, tiled image support)

bitfield.name: SHADER_HAS_W
bitfield.brief: W is sent to SH from RA

bitfield.name: MORE_MINOR_FEATURES
bitfield.doc: Also, in the shader unavailable registers will return 0

bitfield.name: MC20
bitfield.brief: New style MC with separate paths for color and depth

bitfield.name: MSAA_SIDEBAND
bitfield.brief: Put the MSAA data into sideband fifo

bitfield.name: BYPASS_IN_MSAA
bitfield.brief: Shader supports bypass mode when MSAA is enabled

bitfield.name: CORRECT_STENCIL
bitfield.brief: Correct stencil behavior in depth only

bitfield.name: VG_DOUBLE_BUFFER
bitfield.brief: Double buffering support for VG (second TS-->VG semaphore is present)

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_STRIDE
bitfield.brief: Texture has stride and memory addressing

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_ALIGN_4
bitfield.brief: Textures can be aligned to 4 instead of 16

bitfield.name: HALTI0
bitfield.brief: Various features related to texturing and vertex processing
bitfield.doc: - Anisotropic texture filtering - 3D texture support - Texture array support - GL_(INT|UNSIGNED)_10_10_10_2_OES texture / vertex support - 16 attr per vertex i.s.o. 10, and 12 varyings i.s.o. 8

bitfield.name: TEXTURE_TILED_READ
bitfield.brief: Tiled read also available with COMPOSITION

value.name: ZERO
value.brief: Sets the stencil buffer value to 0

value.name: REPLACE
value.brief: Sets the stencil value to ref

value.name: INCR
value.brief: Increments stencil buffer value, clamps to max

value.name: DECR
value.brief: Descrements stencil buffer value, clamps to min

value.name: INVERT
value.brief: Bitwise inverts the current stencil buffer value

value.name: INCR_WRAP
value.brief: Increments stencil buffer value, wraps around

value.name: DECR_WRAP
value.brief: Decrements stencil buffer value, wraps around

enum.name: BLEND_EQ
enum.doc: determines how pixel blending combines source and destination

value.name: DXT4_DXT5
value.doc: DXT4/DXT5 compressed textures are stored untiled.

value.name: ETC1
value.doc: ETC compressed textures are stored untiled.

enum.name: TEXTURE_FACE
enum.doc: Offset into texture memory for cube map face

enum.name: SYNC_RECIPIENT
enum.doc: This is used for synchronization primitives, for example for semaphores and stalling

stripe.name: HI
stripe.doc: Host interface contains bits to identify the chip, control clock speed, and enable/acknowledge interrupts.

reg32.name: IDLE_STATE
reg32.doc: Bits are 1 if the module is idle, 0 otherwise.

bitfield.name: AXI_LP
bitfield.brief: AXI bus in low power mode

reg32.name: PROFILE_WRITE_BURSTS
reg32.brief: Total write Data Count in terms of 64bits value

reg32.name: PROFILE_READ_BURSTS
reg32.brief: Total Read Data Count in terms of 64bits

reg32.name: GP_OUT0
reg32.brief: General Purpose output register0. R/W but not connected to anywhere

reg32.name: GP_OUT1
reg32.brief: General Purpose output register1. R/W but not connected to anywhere

reg32.name: GP_OUT2
reg32.brief: General Purpose output register2. R/W but not connected to anywhere

reg32.name: PROFILE_TOTAL_CYCLES
reg32.doc: This register is a free running counter. It can be reset by writing 0 to it.

reg32.name: PROFILE_IDLE_CYCLES
reg32.brief: Total cycles where the GPU is idle
reg32.doc: It is reset when PROFILE_TOTAL_CYCLES register is written to. It looks at all the blocks but FE when determining the IP is idle.

stripe.name: PM
stripe.doc: Features to control power usage.

stripe.name: MMUv2
stripe.doc: New MMU unit. Only exists on more recent hardware.

stripe.name: FE
stripe.doc: DMA engine. This is the frontend from the CPU to the GPU, and takes care of parsing the command stream and loading states, as well as loading vertex streams.

bitfield.name: NONCONSECUTIVE
bitfield.brief: Enable when this is not consecutive to previous element, or it is the last element

reg32.name: COMMAND_ADDRESS
reg32.brief: Base address for the command buffer
reg32.doc: The address must be 64-bit aligned and it is always physical. This register cannot be read.

bitfield.name: PREFETCH
bitfield.brief: Number of 64-bit words to fetch from the command buffer

stripe.name: GL
stripe.doc: Global device control states. Here is configured what pipe to use (2D or 3D), when to send event, when to wait on semaphores and the API mode (OGL or D3D).

reg32.name: SEMAPHORE_TOKEN
reg32.brief: A sempahore state arms the semaphore in the destination

reg32.name: FLUSH_MMU
reg32.brief: Flush the virtual addrses lookup cache inside the MC

bitfield.name: FLUSH_FEMMU
bitfield.brief: Flush the FE address translation caches

bitfield.name: FLUSH_PEMMU
bitfield.brief: Flush the PE render target address translation caches

reg32.name: VARYING_TOTAL_COMPONENTS
reg32.brief: Total number of components in all varyings
reg32.doc: Number of components for all varyings together.

reg32.name: VARYING_COMPONENT_USE
reg32.doc: 2 bits per varying component, 16 components per 32-bit word.

value.name: STREAM
value.brief: From command stream: set for mono expansion blits or masked blits

stripe.name: DE
stripe.doc: 2D drawing engine: conversion, scaling, filtering, rotation, blending of 2D images.

stripe.name: VS
stripe.doc: The vertex shader to be used for 3D rendering is configured here.

reg32.name: OUTPUT
reg32.doc: Each bitfield (up to 16 in total) contains a temporary register number that is used as output at the end of the shader for that varying.

reg32.name: INPUT
reg32.doc: Each bitfield (up to 16 in total) contains a temporary register number that is assigned the input for that attribute at the beginning of shader execution.

stripe.name: THREAD_WALKER
stripe.doc: The thread walker drives shaders in a predefined grid for GPGPU computing (OpenCL). These states are not used for normal rendering.

reg32.name: KICKER
reg32.doc: Write some value to this register to kick off thread walker

stripe.name: PA
stripe.doc: Primitive assembly assembles primitives (tris, quads, lines, points etc) from vertices for 3D rendering. Viewport scaling, line width and point size is configured here.

reg32.name: CONFIG
reg32.doc: These can be set either per group of bits, or all at once, by using masking flags. Each group of state flags has a masking flag that prevents overwriting the flags in that group.

value.name: CW
value.brief: Orientation of front-facing polygons is clockwise

value.name: CCW
value.brief: Orientation of front-facing polygons is counter-clockwise

stripe.name: SE
stripe.doc: The setup engine takes care of scissor, clipping, and depth scale.

stripe.name: RA
stripe.doc: Configuration for the rasterizer. This mainly controls multisampling.

bitfield.name: UNK1
bitfield.doc: Set based on number of PS varyings

stripe.name: PS
stripe.doc: The Pixel (Fragment) shader to use is configured here

reg32.name: OUTPUT_REG
reg32.brief: Register that will contain output color

stripe.name: PE
stripe.doc:
The Pixel Engine takes care of writing pixels to the framebuffer, doing blending, depth testing and alpha testing if needed.
Some flags can be set either per group of bits, or all at once, by using masking flags. Each group of state flags has a masking flag that when set prevents overwriting the flags in that group. These will be called FOO_MASK if the state to be masked is called FOO.

reg32.name: STENCIL_CONFIG
reg32.doc: Warning: confusing terminology. WRITE_MASK is the stencil write mask, the state bits can be masked with WRITE_MASK_MASK.

bitfield.name: MASK_FRONT
bitfield.doc: XXX there appears to be no specific MASK_BACK, this state is used for both front and back?

bitfield.name: PARTIAL
bitfield.brief: Set when alpha blending enabled or otherwise the destination is not fully overwritten

value.name: D24S8
value.brief: 24 bit depth (+8 bit stencil or padding)

stripe.name: CO
stripe.doc: Hardware composer. This functionality is present on some GCxxxx chips and allows for blending surfaces together with Porter-Diff composition methods, to accelerate the likes of Surfaceflinger (Android).

stripe.name: RS
stripe.doc:
To my current understanding, RESOLVE is a multifunctional copy/fill engine that can copy blocks of pixels from one place in memory to another, actually clearing tiles that are marked as cleared in the process. Other capabilities are:
- Conversion between pixel formats - Downsampling (2x horizontal or horizontal and vertical) - Fill with constant value - Partial fill (only clear part of the channels) - Tiling / untiling, for normal tiled and supertiled surfaces - Swap blue and red channels, flip image in Y - Endian swapping - Fill tiles that are marked as 'cleared' in the Tile Status
The following render target tilings are possible:
A B 0 0 Linear 1 0 Tiled (4x4, like textures) 0 1 (same as tiled=0, supertiled=0) 1 1 Supertiled (64x64)
A) tiled: SOURCE_TILED, DEST_TILED in CONFIG word B) supertiled: TILING bit in SOURCE_STRIDE / DEST_STRIDE

reg32.name: KICKER
reg32.doc: Write some value to this register to kick off resolver

bitfield.name: DOWNSAMPLE
bitfield.doc: A resolve operation can downsample a surface. This functionality is also used to compute mipmaps.

reg32.name: WINDOW_SIZE
reg32.doc: When downsampling the source and destination size will be different. In this case, the WINDOW_SIZE will be the (unscaled) source size.

bitfield.name: BITS
bitfield.brief: Affects which channels of which tiles are cleared
bitfield.doc:
Four groups (per tile) of four bits (per channel) that affect which channels of which tiles are cleared. In mode 'enabled' only the lower four bits are used, in 'enabled2' all four groups are used.
Components that are disabled are not written at all by the clear logic (they keep their old value) they are not copied from the source.

bitfield.name: MODE
bitfield.doc: Depending on the clear mode, the RS does different things: - If disabled, it is a copy engine - If enabled, it fills the target area with FILL_VALUE(0) and disregards the source - If enabled2, it fills the target area with the four FILL_VALUEs (results in vertical stripes of width 4, at least with supertiled target) and disregards the source.

stripe.name: TS
stripe.doc: Tile status block contains information about the tiles to be resolved. It is used by the PE (to read/update tile status) as well as the RS (to read tile status).

reg32.name: MEM_CONFIG
reg32.doc: Tile status config. Setting this value to 0 disables tile status and makes the resolve work like a normal copy engine.

bitfield.name: DEPTH_AUTO_DISABLE
bitfield.brief: Auto disable fast clear for depth

bitfield.name: COLOR_AUTO_DISABLE
bitfield.brief: Auto disable fast clear for color

bitfield.name: MSAA
bitfield.brief: This bit is enabled when MSAA samples >= 2
bitfield.doc: The main bits for switching MSAA in rendering are in register #0x03818, these bits in the TS memory configuration appear to affect the writing of tiles in a minor way.

stripe.name: YUV
stripe.doc: The YUV tiler can combine planar YUV formats to RGB or non-planar YUV formats.

bitfield.name: MAX
bitfield.doc: This fixed-point value is the maximum LOD level. It can be a fractional value, up to the number of defined mipmaps.

bitfield.name: MIN
bitfield.doc: This fixed-point value is the minimum LOD level. It can be a fractional value.

bitfield.name: BIAS
bitfield.doc: This fixed-point value is added to the computed LOD level when BIAS_ENABLE is on. It appears that it can also be negative by using two's complement arithmetic.

stripe.name: TE
stripe.doc: Texture sampling, filtering, LOD, etc

stripe.name: NTE
stripe.doc: Extra texture states for newer hardware. These exist if chipMinorFeatures2 bit 11 set.

stripe.name: SH
stripe.doc: Shader instruction memory on new hardware that supports more than 256, or more than 1024 shader instructions (different areas are used based on these cases).

stripe.name: DUMMY
stripe.doc: Dummy state write, sometimes used for inserting padding or small delays into the command stream.
